thread.title: Albany's win first this season
thread.title_full: Albany's win first this season - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Albany's win first this season
text:
Blake Pietila scored the game-winning goal early in the third period and the Albany Devils earned their first win of the season, 3-2 over the host Toronto Marlies on Sunday at Ricoh Coliseum.
Albany moved to 1-1-1-0 and Toronto dropped to 3-1-0-0.
Jim O'Brien opened the scoring at 5:52 of the second period to give Albany a 1-0 edge, but Toronto erased the deficit with back-to-back goals.
Matt Frattin tied the game at 8:39 and Kasperi Kapanen put the hosts in front 2-1 at 9:50. The score remained intact until 14:00 when Mike Sislo found the back of the net and pulled Albany even at 2 and Paul Thompson found Pietila for the go-ahead goal.
Yann Danis earned the win and made 26 saves for the Devils. Garret Sparks stopped 28 shots for the Marlies.
Albany will wrap up a four-game road trip at 7 p.m. Friday at Portland.
More Information
Devils 3, Marlies 2
Albany 0 2 1 — 3
Toronto 0 2 0 — 2
First period— No Scoring. Penalties—O'Brien Alb (elbowing), 1:23; Tropp Alb (slashing), 10:54; Holl Tor (interference), 16:54; Valiev Tor (interference), 18:39.
Second period— 1, Albany, O'Brien 1 (Kelly), 5:52 (SH). 2, Toronto, Frattin 1 (Nylander, Brown), 8:39. 3, Toronto, Kapanen 1 (Brennan, Percy), 9:50. 4, Albany, Sislo 2 (Gragnani, Lorito), 14:00 (PP). Penalties—Pelley Alb (slashing), 5:39; Frattin Tor (slashing), 6:29; Loov Tor (holding), 13:21.
Third period— 5, Albany, Pietila 1 (Thompson, Black), 3:24. Penalties—Blandisi Alb (interference), 0:13; Hyman Tor (slashing), 12:17; Tropp Alb (tripping), 12:59; Lorito Alb (hooking), 18:11.
Shots on goal— Albany 9-17-5-31. Toronto 12-10-6-28.
Power-play opportunities— Albany 1 / 5; Toronto 0 / 6.
Goalies— Albany, Danis 1-1-0 (28 shots-26 saves). Toronto, Sparks 1-1-0 (31 shots-28 saves).
A— 3,418
